author: Bahá'u'lláh
source_text: لَكَ الحَمْدُ يا إِلهِي وَإِلهَ العالَمِينَ وَمَقْصُودِي وَمَقْصُودَ العارِفِينَ وَمَحْبُوبِيْ وَمَحْبُوبَ المُوَحِّدِينَ وَمَعْبُودِيْ وَمَعْبُودَ المُقَرَّبِيْنَ وَمُنايَ وَمُنَى المُخْلِصِيْنَ وَرَجائِي وَرَجاءَ الآمِلِينَ وَمَلاذِي وَمَلاذَ القاصِدِيْنَ وَمَلْجَأيْ وَمَلْجَأَ اللآئِذِينَ وَمَقْصَدِيْ وَمَقْصَدَ المُتَوَجِّهِينَ وَمَنْظَرِيْ وَمَنْظَرَ النَّاظِرِيْنَ وَجَنَّتِي وَجَنَّةَ البالِغِينَ وَكَعْبَتِيْ وَكَعْبَةَ المُشْتاقِينَ وَجَذْبِي وَجَذْبَ العاشِقِينَ وَنُورِيْ وَنُورَ الهائِمِينَ التَّائِبِينَ وَوَلَهِيْ وَوَلَهَ الذَّاكرِينَ وَكَهْفِيْ وَكَهْفَ الهارِبِينَ وَحِصْنِيْ وَحِصْنَ الخائِفِينَ وَرَبِّيْ وَرَبَّ مَنْ فِي السَّمَواتِ وَالأَرَضِيْنَ، بِما جَعَلْتَنِيْ مُنْجَذِبًا بِآياتِكَ وَمُتَوَجِّهًا إِلى أُفُقٍ مِنْهُ أَشْرَقَتْ أَنْوارُ شَمْسِ وِجْهَتِكَ وَمُقْبِلاً إِذْ كانَ مُعْرِضًا أَكثَرُ خَلْقِكَ، أَنْتَ الَّذِيْ يا إِلهِي
translation: Praise be unto Thee, Who art my God and the God of all men, and my Desire and the Desire of all them that have recognized Thee, and my Beloved and the Beloved of such as have acknowledged Thy unity, and the Object of my adoration and of the adoration of them that have near access to Thee, and my Wish and the Wish of such as are wholly devoted to Thee, and my Hope and the Hope of them that have fixed their hearts upon Thee, and my Refuge and the Refuge of all such as have hastened towards Thee, and my Haven and the Haven of whosoever hath repaired unto Thee, and my Goal and the Goal of all them that have set themselves towards Thee, and my Object and the Object of those who have fixed their gaze upon Thee, and my Paradise and the Paradise of them that have ascended towards Thee, and my Lodestar and the Lodestar of all such as yearn after Thee, and my Joy and the Joy of all them that love Thee, and my Light and the Light of all such as have erred and asked to be forgiven by Thee, and my Exultation and the Exultation of all them that remember Thee, and my Stronghold and the Stronghold of all such as have fled to Thee, and my Sanctuary and the Sanctuary of all that dread Thee, and my Lord and the Lord of all such as dwell in the heavens and on the earth!

alignment.en: all them that have recognized Thee
such as are wholly devoted to Thee
them that have fixed their hearts upon Thee
all such as have hastened towards Thee
them that have ascended towards Thee
all such as yearn after Thee
all such as have fled to Thee

terms.note: Typically rendered 'All praise' or 'Praise be to Thee' across 25 occurrences. Here SE selects 'Praise be unto Thee,' maintaining the formal liturgical register essential to this invocation's opening.

Root encompasses radiance, revelation, dawn across 63 occurrences. SE renders 'have shone forth,' emphasizing active emanation rather than 'dawning' or 'revelation,' appropriate to this light-metaphor climax.
Face/countenance/direction across 64 occurrences; SE chooses 'Thy Countenance' rather than 'Thy face,' elevating to theological abstraction befitting divine presence language.

terms.literal: to turn away; to avert; to abstain; heedless
terms.note: Typically 'turned away' or 'turned aside' across 47 occurrences. SE maintains 'turned away' here, creating stark contrast with the speaker's 'approaching' posture in the theodicy of acceptance.
